conclusion: To find the work done by the gas from state B to state C, analyze the p-V diagram.
The work done by the gas during a process is given by the area under the curve on a p-V diagram.
From state B to state C, the pressure remains constant at 2 x 10^5 Pa.
This is an isobaric process (constant pressure).
Volume at state B is 2 x 10^-3 m^3.
Volume at state C is 3 x 10^-3 m^3.
Change in volume, ΔV = VC - VB = (3 - 2) x 10^-3 m^3 = 1 x 10^-3 m^3.
For an isobaric process, the work done by the gas is given by W = P ΔV.
Substitute P = 2 x 10^5 Pa and ΔV = 1 x 10^-3 m^3 into W = P ΔV.
Calculate W = (2 x 10^5 Pa) x (1 x 10^-3 m^3) = 200 J.
The work done externally by the gas from state B to state C is 200 Joules.
